text: Thanks <@U026E0ZNR>! Interesting thing is that I didn’t see any Ogg/v mention for video but only audio.

I think it’s because WebM an Ogg are equally weighted competitors. W3 schools makes it look like there’s no need for Ogg, and if that’s the format we have the most issues with, we can safely ditch it, I think. <http://www.w3schools.com/html/html5_video.asp>

text: Interesting thing on that W3 article, Firefox is now partially supporting MP4 format for some Windows base platforms.
They apparently will soon be supporting some Mac platforms in the near future.

Awesome, <@U026E0ZNR> .  So I think that we can still include an ogg for those older browsers since Miro Video Converter can export that too. We don’t need to worry about the quality issues we saw last week as MP4 and WebM got us covered on most modern browsers.
